intro: Scabiosa turolensis subsp. maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan scabious, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it is often found in mountainous regions. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
